questions.question_text: Which of the following describe migration from single-site to multisite index replication?

discussion.content: Answer is B

comments.content:
Maintain legacy buckets as single-site
By default, after migration, the cluster holds both single-site and multisite buckets. It maintains them separately, following these rules:

Single-site legacy buckets (those existing at the time of migration) continue to respect the single-site replication_factor and search_factor settings.
Multisite buckets (those created after migration) follow the multisite site_replication_factor and site_search_factor policies.

Answer is B

discussion.content:
cluster pdf (migration Notes) pg:72

B only correct
D is wrong. If you are migrating from a single-site cluster, the total value must be at least as large as the replication_factor. so Total >= replication factor
After migration, all buckets created before migration continue to adhere to their single-site replication and search factor policies by default.

Selected Answer: C

Exclude the dispatch directory
This example excludes content on the component level. Exclude the dispatch directory to avoid gathering search artifacts (which can be very costly on a pooled search head):

$SPLUNK_HOME/bin/splunk diag --disable=dispatch

C is correct

C is correct answer

splunk diag --exclude "*/passwd" --exclude "*/dispatch/*"
Files excluded by the --exclude feature are listed in excluded_filelist.txt in the diag bundle to ensure Splunk Support can interpret the diag.

Exclude the dispatch directory
This example excludes content on the component level. Exclude the dispatch directory to avoid gathering search artifacts (which can be very costly on a pooled search head):

$SPLUNK_HOME/bin/splunk diag --disable=dispatch

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a way to exclude search artifacts when creating a diag?
Which of the following statements describe licensing in a clustered Splunk deployment? (Select all that apply.)

discussion.content: A,B,D - https://www.splunk.com/en_us/software/features-comparison-chart.html
ABD are the correct answers

ABD

All clusters must share same license pool (Cluster admin course page-13)

Selected Answer: AD
A. Free licenses do not support clustering. 
B. Replicated data does not count against licensing.
D. Cluster members must share the same license pool and license master

A. Free licenses do not support clustering: This statement is true. Free licenses do not support clustering.

B. Replicated data does not count against licensing: This statement is true. Replicated data does not count against licensing.

C. Each cluster member requires its own clustering license: This statement is false. Cluster members do not require their own clustering license. Rather, clustering is licensed based on the amount of data indexed by the cluster as a whole. Each cluster requires a license that covers the amount of data indexed by the entire cluster.

D. Cluster members must share the same license pool and license master: This statement is true. Cluster members must share the same license pool and license master. The license master is responsible for managing the licenses for the entire cluster, and all cluster members must be configured to use the same license pool and license master.

also D should be true "Cluster nodes must all share the same licensing configuration."
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.0/Admin/Distdeploylicenses

Selected Answer: AB
A,B,D should be the answers

A,B,D

- All cluster nodes, including manager nodes, peer nodes, and search heads, need to be in an Enterprise license pool, even if they're not expected to index any data.
- Cluster nodes must share the same licensing configuration.
- Only incoming data counts against the license; replicated data does not.
- You cannot use index replication with a free license.

A/B

D is not correct. Cluster members does not have to be same license pool and master
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.0/Admin/Distdeploylicenses

Each indexer cluster node requires an Enterprise license. There are a few license issues that are specific to indexer clusters:

 Cluster nodes must all share the same licensing configuration.
 Only incoming data counts against the license; replicated data does not.

Actually D is not mandatory:
D. Cluster members must share the same license pool and license master.

That is not correct with the word "Must" > Only Must is -> Cluster nodes must all share the same licensing configuration.
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.0/Admin/Distdeploylicenses
ABD are correct
A,B,D are correct
The Free license is for a standalone, single-instance use only installation.

choices.B: Replicated data does not count against licensing.
choices.A: Free licenses do not support clustering.
choices.C: Each cluster member requires its own clustering license.
choices.D: Cluster members must share the same license pool and license master.

questions.question_text: When planning a search head cluster, which of the following is true?

choices.C: The search head captain must be assigned to the largest search head in the cluster.
choices.B: All search heads must be members of the cluster (no standalone search heads).
choices.A: All search heads must use the same operating system.
choices.D: All indexers must belong to the underlying indexer cluster (no standalone indexers).

discussion.content: Correct Answer is A - https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.0.6/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A

Selected Answer: A
The correct Answer is A

I almost got caught by C. If the systems are different: The search head captain must be assigned to the SMALLest search head in the cluster. Otherwise it might overload one of the other members, assuming it is bigger than it is.

Selected Answer: C
Is C:
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.5/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements
All search head cluster members most have the same OS version. and the index cluster most have the same OS as the search head cluster members.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Answer: A 

Each member must run on its own machine or virtual machine, and all machines must run the same operating system and version
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/9.0.2/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer is A - https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.0.6/DistSearch/SHCsystemrequirements
A is correct
A is correct.
